org.jcvi.jillion.core

Interface SequenceBuilder<T,S extends Sequence<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Type of element in the sequence
    S - the Type of Sequence to be built.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<S>, Iterable<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NucleotideSequenceBuilder, PositionSequenceBuilder, ProteinSequenceBuilder, QualitySequenceBuilder

    public interface SequenceBuilder<T,S extends Sequence<T>>
extends Builder<S>, Iterable<T>
    NucleotideSequenceBuilder is a way to construct a Sequence similar to how a StringBuilder can be used to create a String. The contents of the Sequence can be changed by method calls.

    SequenceBuilder uses method chaining to make combining several operations easier to read. The build() method will return an instance of the Sequence.

    Implementations of SequenceBuilder are probably not thread safe unless thread safety is explicitly mentioned.

    Author:
    dkatzel

        Appends the given symbol to the end of the builder's mutable sequence.

        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the symbol is null.

        Get the element at the given offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset-th element of the sequence to get.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset is < 0 or ≥ length.

        long getLength()
        Get the current length of the mutable sequence.
        Returns:
        the current length of the nucleotide sequence.

      • replace

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> replace(int offset,
                             T replacement)
        Replace the residue at the given offset with a different nucleotide.
        Parameters:
        offset - the gapped offset to modify.
        replacement - the new Residue to replace the old Residue at that location.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if replacement is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset is invalid.

      • delete

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> delete(Range range)
        Deletes the nucleotides from the given range of this partially constructed residue sequence. If the given range is empty, then the residue sequence will not be modified. If the range extends beyond the currently built sequence, then this will delete until the end of the sequence.
        Parameters:
        range - the range to delete can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if range's start is negative or greater than this residue sequence's current length.

      • insert

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> insert(int offset,
                            T base)
        Inserts the given Residue to the builder's mutable sequence at the given offset. If any nucleotides existed downstream of this offset before this insert method was executed, then those nucleotides will be shifted by 1 base.
        Parameters:
        offset - the GAPPED offset into this mutable sequence to begin insertion.
        base - the Residue to be inserted at the given offset.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if base is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset < 0 or > current sequence length.

      • build

        S build()
        Create a new instance using the data collected by this builder thus far.

        Create a new Sequence instance from the current mutable elements. This method does not destroy any temp data so this method could be called multiple times each time creating a new Sequence.

        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<S extends Sequence<T>>
        Returns:
        a new Sequence; will never null but may be empty.

      • trim

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> trim(Range range)
        Modify the current sequence to keep only that the sub sequence within the given Range. If the range extends beyond the current sequence, then this will keep all the symbols until the end of the sequence. If the trim range is empty, then the entire sequence will be trimmed.
        Parameters:
        range - the range of residues to keep (gapped).
        Returns:
        this.

      • copy

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> copy()
        Create a new deep copy instance of the Builder. Any downstream modifications to either this Builder or the returned one are independent of each other.
        Returns:
        a new SequenceBuilder that contains the same state as this builder; will never be null.

      • toString

        String toString()
        Get the current symbols as a String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • reverse

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> reverse()
        Reverse but not complement all the symbols currently in this builder. Calling this method will only reverse symbols that already exist in this builder; any additional operations to insert symbols will not be affected.
        Returns:
        this.

      • iterator

        Iterator<T> iterator()
        Creates an Iterator which iterates over the current sequence. Any changes to this SequenceBuilder between creating this iterator and actually iterating over the elements might not be seen by this iterator.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<T>

      • clear

        SequenceBuilder<T,S> clear()
        Removes all the current values from the builder and sets the length to 0.
        Returns:
        this.
